election_record.label: Massachusetts 1815 Governor

overview.note: There was considerable controversy over whether those citizens living on plantations in what is now the state of Maine should be allowed to vote in state elections. They did not pay taxes and many thought they should thus not be allowed to vote. Beginning in 1814, in many of the plantations, the votes were cast and counted and included separately in the Original Election Returns, with their totals not included among the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: New Marlborough
sub_unit.note: Samuel Dexter received 11 votes as Salmon Dexter.

sub_unit.name: Peru
sub_unit.note: The Town Records of Peru list 22 votes for Samuel Dexter.

sub_unit.name: Attleborough
sub_unit.note: The votes from Attleborough were rejected.

"The Committee further reported that they had rejected the following returns of votes: From Attleborough, it not appearing on the return that the voters were legally qualified to vote for Governor, etc." Dedham Gazette (Dedham, MA). June 9. 1815.

sub_unit.name: Westport
sub_unit.note: The votes from Westport were rejected.

"The Committee further reported that they had rejected the following returns of votes: From Westport, the return not having been certified by the Town Clerk." Dedham Gazette (Dedham, MA). June 9. 1815.

sub_unit.name: Ware
sub_unit.note: The votes from Ware were rejected.
"The Committee further reported that they had rejected the following returns of votes: From Ware, it being dated 1814, instead of the current year." Dedham Gazette (Dedham, MA). June 9. 1815.

sub_unit.name: Bangor
sub_unit.note: History of Penobscot County, Maine 570, lists 65 votes for Caleb Strong in town of Bangor.

sub_unit.name: Garland
sub_unit.note: The votes from Garland were rejected.
"No Return." Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Jackson
sub_unit.note: Jackson was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Knox
sub_unit.note: Knox was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Lincoln
sub_unit.note: Lincoln was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.note: Swan was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Washington
sub_unit.note: Washington was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Number 2 in 1st Range
sub_unit.note: Number 2 in 1st Range was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.
There were no votes recorded in Number 2 in 1st Range for Governor though there were votes for Lieutenant Governor.

sub_unit.name: Number 4 in 2nd Range
sub_unit.note: Number 4 in 2nd Range was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.note: Number 1 in 3rd Range was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.note: Number 3 in 3rd Range was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Number 3 in 6th Range
sub_unit.note: Number 3 in 6th Range was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Plantation adjacent to Sullivan
sub_unit.note: Plantation adjacent to Sullivan was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Rome
sub_unit.note: The votes from Rome were rejected.

"The Committee further reported that they had rejected the following returns of votes: From Rome, it having been opened when delivered in the Secretary's Office; and not having been signed by any person in the capacity of Selectmen." Dedham Gazette (Dedham, MA). June 9. 1815.

sub_unit.name: 25 Mile Pond
sub_unit.note: 25 Mile Pond was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Wilton
sub_unit.note: The votes from Wilton were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Appleton Plantation
sub_unit.note: Appleton Plantation was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Bowdoin
sub_unit.note: Votes for Caleb Strong from Bowdoin were not reported.

sub_unit.name: Cushing
sub_unit.note: The Records of the Lower St. Georges and Cushing, Maine, 1605-1897 reports 21 votes for Caleb Strong in Cushing.

sub_unit.name: Edgecomb
sub_unit.note: The votes from Edgecomb were rejected.
"The Committee further reported that they had rejected the following returns of votes: From Edgecomb, no person having signed it as Selectmen." Dedham Gazette (Dedham, MA). June 9. 1815.

sub_unit.name: Montville
sub_unit.note: Montville was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Wales Plantation
sub_unit.note: Wales Plantation was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Hebron
sub_unit.note: "Rejected." Original Election Returns.

"The Committee further reported that they had rejected the following returns of votes: From Hebron, the year in which the meeting was holden not appearing on the return." Deadham Gazette. June 9, 1815.

sub_unit.name: Howards Gore
sub_unit.note: Howards Gore was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.note: Plantation Number 4 was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.note: Number 1 West of Kennebec River was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.note: Number 6th in 7th Range was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: "Rejected". Original Election Returns.
"The Committee further reported that they had rejected the following returns of votes: From Addison, it not having been certified by the Town Clerk." Dedham Gazette (Dedham, MA). June 9, 1815.

sub_unit.name: Cherryfield
sub_unit.note: Cherryfield was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.name: Eastport
sub_unit.note: "No return." Original Election Returns.
From 1814 to 1818, Eastport was under British control..

sub_unit.name: Number 1
sub_unit.note: Number 1 was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.

sub_unit.note: Plantation No. 11 was a plantation whose votes were counted and listed in the Original Election Returns but which were not included in the aggregate state totals.
